snippet: Science has released two papers that it says repudiate research that led to speculation about extraterrestrial life by concluding that bacteria could grow by substituting arsenic for phosphorus.
abstract: Journal Science releases two studies that it says repudiate the findings of a provocative 2010 study claiming that bacteria in a California lake thrived on arsenic; original research, backed by NASA and also published in Science, had provoked speculation about the possibility of life existing on other planets.
lead_paragraph: Science has released two papers that it says repudiate research that led to speculation about extraterrestrial life by concluding that bacteria could grow by substituting arsenic for phosphorus.

headline.seo: New Studies Rebut Finding That Arsenic May Support Life
headline.main: Studies Rebut Finding That Arsenic May Support Life
headline.print_headline: Studies Rebut Finding That Arsenic May Support Life
